text: Korea Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages is an academic and professional association that helps teachers of English as a Foreign Language (EFL). It is often called KOTESOL for short. == History == KOTESOL started in 1992 when the Association of English Teachers in Korea (AETK) and the Korea Association of Teachers of English (KATE) joined. ==Organization== KOTESOL members may join a smaller group called a Chapter. These are the Chapters of KOTESOL: * Busan-Gyeongnam * Daegu-Gyeongbuk * Daejeon-Chungcheong * Gangwon * Gwangju-Jeonnam * International Community * Jeju * Jeonju-North Jeolla * Seoul * Suwon-Gyeonggi * Yongin-Gyeonggi == Annual conference == KOTESOL has a conference every year with papers, keynote speakers, workshops, and social events. == Partners == KOTESOL has relationships with several other language teaching associations: * Australian Council of TESOL Associations (ACTA) * English Teachers' Association of the Republic of China (ETA-ROC) * Far Eastern English Language Teachers Association (FEELTA) of Russia * Philippine Association for Language Teaching, Inc (PALT) * Japan Association for Language Teaching * TESOL International Association * Thailand TESOL (ThaiTESOL) == References == ==Other websites== *KOTESOL Home Page Category:Language education Category:Educational organizations Category:Organizations based in South Korea
title: Korea Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages
